clinical_study.brief_title: Distant Management of Crohn's Disease by Smartphones is Feasible and Effective Additionally it Reduces the Costs
clinical_study.official_title: Implementation and Evaluation of Smartphone-Based Videoconferance Telehealth for Patients With Crohn's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of the feasibility, acceptability, patient satisfaction and economic benefits of smartphone video-based telehealth in the management of Crohn's disease patients

detailed_description.textblock: Patients were examined by two gastroenterologists (HY, AED) either at a video conference based visit or face to face visit in outpatients clinics. We used the WhatsApp business application.The online visit notion was the same as traditional face-to-face visit except physical examination.

primary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction score with the video visits
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of satisfaction with RAND Visit Specific Questionnaire (VSQ9),Minimum score "0" poor and maximum score is "5" represents excellent,

arm_group.description: This group will receive a traditional outpatient visit
This group will receive a smartphone-based real-time video conference visit

intervention.description: Participants have received an online visit by a smartphone application

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The study group included patients with documented Crohn's disease, based on clinical, endoscopic, and histologic findings
- Patient between 18-80 years old
- Participants who have been receiving treatment for more than six months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients were excluded from the study if they had no internet connection
- Unable to use smartphones because of blindness, deafness, or mental disorders

patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available for one year after the study completed
